en: Who designed the White House?
zh: 白宫是谁设计的？

en: Mr White made a few comments on my speech.
zh: 怀特先生对我的演讲提了几点意见。

en: Mr White is about my age.
zh: 怀特先生跟我差不多大。

en: Miss White is liked by everyone.
zh: 大家都很喜欢怀特小姐。

en: Mr White's yard is large.
zh: 怀特先生家的院子很大。

en: Why don't you ask Mr White?
zh: 你干嘛不问问怀特先生？

en: Allow me to introduce you to Mr White.
zh: 我来给你介绍一下怀特先生吧。

en: Talking of Mr White, where is he living now?
zh: 说到怀特先生，他现在住哪儿呢？

en: A ragged coat may cover an honest man.
zh: 穿得破破烂烂的人也可能是个老实人。

en: I'm getting high.
zh: 我有点嗨了。

en: In the collision with a Volvo, our car naturally got the worst of it.
zh: 跟沃尔沃撞上，我们的车肯定吃亏啊。

en: Skinflicks usually play in old theaters in a sleazy part of town.
zh: 这种小电影通常在市中心地段不好的老戏院放。

en: Would you mind turning down the volume?
zh: 你能把声音开小点吗？

en: Do you offer a volume discount? If so, please send details.
zh: 批量买有折扣吗？如果有的话，请发一下详细资料。

en: She was vaccinated against polio.
zh: 她接种了小儿麻痹症疫苗。

en: Here she is!
zh: 她在这儿呢！

en: Here he comes.
zh: 他来了。

en: It's that time again! Wake up.
zh: 又到时候了！快醒醒。

en: Here's my wallet.
zh: 给，这是我的钱包。

en: "Look," she said.
zh: “看，”她说。

en: The volunteer group provides war victims with food and medicine.
zh: 那个志愿者组织为战争受害者提供食物和药品。

en: Here comes the bus!
zh: 公交车来了！

en: It is raining, you see.
zh: 你看，下雨了。

en: See, you shouldn't work so hard.
zh: 你看，你没必要这么拼命。

en: I'm going to see a horror film.
zh: 我打算去看部恐怖片。

en: There! That wasn't long, was it?
zh: 好了！没用多久，对吧？

en: Some people derive pleasure from watching horror movies.
zh: 有些人觉得看恐怖片挺享受的。

en: I get goose bumps when I see a horror movie.
zh: 我一看见恐怖片就起鸡皮疙瘩。

en: Here comes the train.
zh: 火车来了。

en: There she comes.
zh: 她过来了。

en: She likes animals, you know?
zh: 你知道的，她喜欢小动物。

en: Here, I got us a bottle of white wine.
zh: 给，我拿了一瓶白葡萄酒。

en: It's starting now.
zh: 现在开始了。

en: Hey, rust is eating away the metal.
zh: 嘿，铁锈正在腐蚀金属。

en: Look, your shoelaces have come undone.
zh: 瞧，你鞋带开了。

en: Here comes Jane. Do you know her?
zh: 简过来了。你认识她吗？

en: Here is my bicycle.
zh: 这是我的自行车。

en: Look, here comes your mother.
zh: 瞧，你妈来了。

en: Look, here comes your train.
zh: 瞧，你那趟火车来了。

en: There is your bag.
zh: 你的包在那儿。

en: Look! There's a cat in the kitchen.
zh: 瞧！厨房里有一只猫。

en: Look! She looks easy.
zh: 瞧！她看起来挺好追的。

en: Look! There's a bird in that tree.
zh: 瞧！那棵树上有只鸟。

en: Praise stimulates students to work hard.
zh: 赞美能激励学生努力学习。

en: It's been raining for around a week.
zh: 雨已经下了快一个星期了。

en: It's close to ten o'clock. It's about time we went to bed.
zh: 快十点了。我们该睡觉了。

en: Uncle Bob fixed my clock. It keeps good time now.
zh: 鲍勃叔叔修好了我的钟。现在走得很准。

en: Bob can drive a car, too.
zh: 鲍勃也会开车。

en: Bob can cook.
zh: 鲍勃会做饭。

en: Bob was beside himself with joy.
zh: 鲍勃简直高兴坏了。

en: Bob is really a brown noser.
zh: Bob真是个马屁精。

en: Bob became an engineer.
zh: Bob当上了一名工程师。

en: Although Bob was in disguise, I recognized him at a glance.
zh: 虽说Bob乔装打扮了一番，但我还是一眼就认出他来了。

en: Bob made her his wife.
zh: Bob娶了她当老婆。

en: Bob usually goes to bed at ten.
zh: Bob通常十点就睡了。

en: Bob has a lot of books in his room.
zh: Bob房间里有很多书。

en: Bob gave Tina almost all the stamps he had collected, and kept only a few for himself.
zh: Bob把他收藏的邮票几乎全给了Tina，自己只留了几张。

en: Bob has too many books to read.
zh: Bob有太多书要读了。

en: Bob could not control his anger.
zh: Bob没能按捺住火气。

en: Bob worked as a clerk in the grocery store on Saturday.
zh: Bob周六在杂货店当过店员。

en: Bob forgot to bring the pass, which made him late for school.
zh: Bob忘了带通行证，导致他上学迟到了。

en: Bob met her grandfather early in the morning.
zh: Bob一大早就遇见了她爷爷。

en: Bob went to meet her grandfather early in the morning.
zh: Bob一大早就去见她爷爷了。

en: Bob was looking for someone to talk with.
zh: Bob正想找个人聊聊天。

en: Bob mounted the portrait in a fancy frame, but it was upside down.
zh: Bob把画像装进了一个漂亮的相框，结果却装反了。

en: Bob entered the house through a window.
zh: Bob是翻窗进屋的。

en: Bob went through many dangers during the war.
zh: Bob在战争中经历了很多危险。

en: Bob asked the teacher some questions.
zh: Bob问了老师几个问题。

en: Is Bob right?
zh: Bob说得对吗？

en: Bob's really chip off the old block.
zh: Bob跟他爸简直就是一个模子里刻出来的。

en: Ten to one, Bob will fail the entrance exam.
zh: 十有八九，Bob这次入学考试得挂。

en: Bob missed the last train and had to take a taxi.
zh: Bob没赶上末班车，只好打车回家。

en: Bob charged 3 dollars an hour for mowing lawns.
zh: Bob帮人割草坪，每小时收费3美元。

en: Bob has to get through this ordeal on his own.
zh: 这个难关Bob得靠自己挺过去。

en: Bob must have had an accident.
zh: Bob肯定是出意外了。

en: Bob is my friend.
zh: Bob是我的朋友。

en: Bob stared me in the face.
zh: Bob死死盯着我的脸。

en: Bob is the only student that can speak Spanish in our class.
zh: Bob是我们班唯一一个会说西班牙语的学生。

en: Bob got impatient at his wife's delay.
zh: Bob对他老婆的磨蹭感到很不耐烦。

en: Bob saw him again.
zh: Bob又见到他了。

en: Bob derives pleasure from observing insects.
zh: Bob很享受观察昆虫的乐趣。

en: Has Bob left the company for good this time?
zh: Bob这次是真的彻底离开公司了吗？

en: Bob will play the leading role for the first time in the next school festival.
zh: 在下次的校庆活动中，Bob将首次担任主角。

en: Bob is down for the coming tennis competition.
zh: Bob报名参加了接下来的网球比赛。

en: Bob was so beside himself that he could scarcely tell fact from fiction.
zh: Bob整个人都失控了，连现实和幻觉都分不清了。

en: Bob was shy when he was a high school student.
zh: Bob上高中的时候挺腼腆的。

en: Bob writes to me once a month.
zh: Bob每个月都会给我写封信。

en: Bob was somewhat chubbier than his brother.
zh: Bob比他兄弟稍微胖点儿。

en: Bob was born in the same year as you.
zh: Bob跟你同岁。

en: Bob is popular at school.
zh: Bob在学校里很受欢迎。

en: Bob rushed into the classroom.
zh: Bob冲进了教室。

en: Bob waved to whomever he saw.
zh: Bob见谁都打招呼。

en: Bob is in the drama club.
zh: Bob在话剧社。

en: Bob lost interest in rock music.
zh: Bob对摇滚乐失去兴趣了。

en: Bob has been sick in bed for a week now.
zh: Bob已经卧床病了一个星期了。

en: Bob seldom talks with Maria without making her angry.
zh: Bob每次跟Maria说话准能把她惹火。

en: Bob seldom writes to his parents.
zh: Bob很少给父母写信。

en: Bob has been engaged to Mary for over a year.
zh: Bob和Mary订婚都一年多了。

en: Bob is kind to those around him.
zh: Bob对身边的人都很友善。

en: Bob filled the pot with water.
zh: Bob往锅里加满了水。

en: Bob made room for an old woman on the bus.
zh: 鲍勃在公交车上给一位老太太让了座。

en: Bob suggested that the party be put off till Wednesday.
zh: 鲍勃建议聚会推迟到周三。

en: Bob sang loudest at the party.
zh: 鲍勃在聚会上唱歌声音最大。

en: Bob is such a nice person that everybody likes him.
zh: 鲍勃这人特别好，大家都挺喜欢他的。

en: Bob was very happy.
zh: 鲍勃挺开心的。

en: Bob is very timid and blushes when chatting with girls.
zh: 鲍勃胆子很小，一跟女生聊天就脸红。

en: Bob is accustomed to hard work.
zh: 鲍勃习惯干重活。

en: Bob often tries to give up smoking.
zh: 鲍勃经常试着戒烟。

en: Bob came home very late.
zh: 鲍勃回家回得很晚。

en: Bob thinks it is a silly idea to call his mother who is so far away, to spend so much, and to say so little.
zh: 鲍勃觉得给大老远的老妈打电话太傻了，花那么多钱还没说两句话。

en: Bob was washing the dishes at that time.
zh: 鲍勃那时候正在洗碗呢。

en: Bob did not agree to the plan.
zh: 鲍勃没同意那个计划。

en: Bob wasn't in on the plan.
zh: 鲍勃没参与那个计划。

en: Bob hurried home in order to watch the TV program.
zh: 鲍勃急着回家看那个电视节目。

en: Bob operates an elevator in the department store.
zh: 鲍勃在百货商店开电梯。

en: Bob brooded on the matter.
zh: 鲍勃一直在琢磨那件事。

en: Bob wanted to keep the fox at home.
zh: 鲍勃想把那只狐狸养在家里。

en: Bob is keen to pass the examination.
zh: 鲍勃一心想通过考试。

en: Bob told Jane not to interfere in his personal affairs.
zh: 鲍勃告诉简别管他的私事。

en: Bob is a good match for you in skating.
zh: 鲍勃滑冰和你水平差不多。

en: Bob seems excited about watching the soccer game.
zh: 鲍勃看足球赛好像挺兴奋的。

en: Bob can answer all the questions.
zh: 鲍勃能回答所有的问题。

en: Bob came here, didn't he?
zh: 鲍勃来过这儿，对吧？

en: Bob expressed words of thanks on behalf of his classmates.
zh: 鲍勃代表全班同学表达了谢意。

en: Bob was popular with all his classmates.
zh: 鲍勃在同学里很受欢迎。

en: I am sure that Bob will pass the examination.
zh: 我敢肯定鲍勃能过考试。

en: Bob plays not only the guitar but also the flute.
zh: 鲍勃不仅会弹吉他，还会吹长笛。

en: Bob found various kinds of nuts.
zh: 鲍勃找到了各种各样的坚果。

en: Bob dropped in at his uncle's house.
zh: 鲍勃顺便去他叔叔家坐了会儿。

en: Can Bob be sick?
zh: 鲍勃该不会是生病了吧？

en: Bob was always in a tight spot with the police.
zh: 鲍勃老是惹上警察，麻烦不断。

en: Bob is a nice person.
zh: 鲍勃是个好人。

en: Bob tried to speak to Anne, but he couldn't.
zh: 鲍勃想跟安妮说话，但没说成。

en: Bob will be home at six.
zh: 鲍勃六点到家。

en: Bob reached the finish line first.
zh: 鲍勃第一个冲到了终点。

en: Bob's father teaches at a girls' school.
zh: 鲍勃的爸爸在一所女校教书。

en: I would rather go to the movie alone than have Bob come with me.
zh: 我宁愿一个人看电影，也不想让鲍勃陪着。

en: As far as Bob is concerned, anything goes. By contrast, Jane is very cautious.
zh: 对鲍勃来说怎么着都行，但简就特别谨慎。

en: Bob and I are great friends.
zh: 鲍勃和我是好哥们。

en: Go easy on Bob. You know, he's been going though a rough period recently.
zh: 对鲍勃宽容点儿，他最近日子挺不好过的。

en: Bob and Mary play the recorder.
zh: 鲍勃和玛丽都吹竖笛。

en: I hear that Bob and Lucy have broken up.
zh: 我听说鲍勃和露西分手了。

en: I found a kindred spirit in Bob.
zh: 我发现我和鲍勃挺投缘的。

en: Bob and Tom are brothers.
zh: 鲍勃和汤姆是亲兄弟。

en: Mr Hobson shut the shop and went home.
zh: 霍布森先生关了店回家了。

en: We won't start till Bob comes.
zh: 鲍勃不来我们就不开始。

en: We will begin the meeting when Bob comes.
zh: 鲍勃一到我们就开会。

en: Bob brought such good news that they jumped up with joy.
zh: 鲍勃带来的好消息让他们高兴得跳了起来。

en: Bob helped me.
zh: 鲍勃帮了我。

en: I doubt if Bob will come on time.
zh: 我怀疑鲍勃能不能准时到。

en: It has been three years since Bob started his own business.
zh: 鲍勃创业已经三年了。

en: Bob can no more swim than a hammer can.
zh: 鲍勃哪会游泳啊，就跟榔头似的。

en: Bob hit me, not her.
zh: 鲍勃打的是我，不是她。

en: To Bob's disappointment, several of those who had promised to help him afterwards backed out.
zh: 让鲍勃失望的是，好几个答应帮他的人后来都反悔了。

en: I don't know when Bob came to Japan.
zh: 我不知道鲍勃是什么时候来日本的。

en: Uncle Bob invited us to have dinner.
zh: 鲍勃叔叔请我们吃晚饭。

en: Bob Johnson tried to make people realize the seriousness of the situation in Africa.
zh: 鲍勃·约翰逊试图让人们意识到非洲局势的严重性。

en: Bob, help me carry his suitcase to the living room.
zh: 鲍勃, 帮我把他的行李箱搬到客厅去。

en: Bobby may watch TV until 7:00.
zh: 鲍比可以看电视看到七点。

en: Bobby must go to bed by 7:30.
zh: 鲍比必须在七点半前睡觉。

en: We're going to begin the descent for Honolulu.
zh: 我们准备开始降落檀香山了。

en: I'd like to return to Tokyo via Honolulu.
zh: 我想经由檀香山回东京。

en: Light shines on my sigh of doubt.
zh: 灯光照在我充满疑惑的叹息上。

en: They're almost three times as big as we are.
zh: 他们几乎有我们的三倍大。

en: Almost every day he goes to the river and fishes.
zh: 他几乎每天都去河边钓鱼。

en: I was barely able to work.
zh: 我几乎没法工作。

en: I got next to nothing.
zh: 我几乎什么都没得到。

en: It was an argument of little substance.
zh: 那次争论没什么实质内容。

en: He studied hard, hardly taking time out for lunch.
zh: 他学习很刻苦，几乎连吃午饭的时间都没有。

en: I can hardly walk.
zh: 我几乎走不动路了。

en: Almost no one goes to the same classes.
zh: 几乎没人上一样的课。

en: Almost no one believed her.
zh: 几乎没人相信她。

en: Most everything has been improved.
zh: 绝大部分东西都改进了。

en: Almost everybody appreciates good food.
zh: 几乎人人都喜欢美食。

en: Almost everybody was invited.
zh: 几乎所有人都被邀请了。

en: Almost all the workers objected to working at night.
zh: 几乎所有的工人都反对上夜班。

en: Almost all of the pupils were in the classroom.
zh: 几乎所有的学生都在教室里。

en: Almost all the students believed the rumor.
zh: 几乎所有的学生都相信了那个谣言。

en: Nearly all men die of their remedies, and not of their illness.
zh: 几乎所有人都是死于治疗，而非死于疾病。

en: Almost all societies now have a money economy based on coins and paper bills of one kind or another.
zh: 现在的社会几乎都采用了基于硬币和纸币的货币经济。

en: Almost everything that is great has been done by youth.
zh: 几乎所有伟大的成就都是年轻人创造的。

en: It was nearly noon.
zh: 快到中午了。

en: Seeing that we have little time, we have to hurry.
zh: 既然时间不多了，咱们得快点。

en: There's very little paper left.
zh: 没剩几张纸了。

en: He's almost as tall as me.
zh: 他快跟我一样高了。

en: You hardly ever work, do you?
zh: 你几乎不干活儿，是吧？

en: I need to put some gas in the car, as it's almost empty.
zh: 我得去给车加点油，快没油了。

en: I know almost nothing about it.
zh: 我对此几乎一无所知。

en: It is hardly raining.
zh: 雨下得特别小。

en: I scarcely slept a wink.
zh: 我几乎一眼没合。

en: Few of the trippers called in at the ghost town of New York.
zh: 没几个游客顺道去过纽约那个鬼镇。

en: Almost all the leaves have fallen.
zh: 叶子几乎快掉光了。

en: He traveled a great deal, as did most of his friends.
zh: 他经常旅游，他的大多数朋友也一样。

en: Most writers are sensitive to criticism.
zh: 大多数作家对批评都很敏感。

en: A 5% consumption tax is levied on purchases of most goods and services.
zh: 大多数商品和服务的购买都要征收5%的消费税。

en: The urban population in most developing countries is increasing very fast.
zh: 大多数发展中国家的城市人口增长非常快。

en: Most Japanese take a bath every day.
zh: 大多数日本人每天都洗澡。

en: Most Japanese eat rice at least once a day.
zh: 大多数日本人每天至少吃一顿米饭。

en: Almost all Japanese boys like to play baseball.
zh: 几乎所有的日本男孩都喜欢打棒球。

en: Most big Japanese companies depend on exports.
zh: 大多数日本大公司都依赖出口。

en: In most Japanese companies, only a few executives have a room to themselves.
zh: 在大多数日本公司里，只有少数高层有独立办公室。

en: Most boys like baseball.
zh: 大多数男生都喜欢棒球。

en: Most experts think a lot of his theory.
zh: 大多数专家对他的理论评价很高。

en: Few people know each other well.
zh: 很少有人互相了解。

en: Most people want to experience happiness.
zh: 大多数人都想过得幸福。

en: Few people know that Mr. Itsumi is from Kansai.
zh: 没几个人知道五味先生是关西人。

en: Few people know about the plan.
zh: 没多少人知道这个计划。

en: I'd heard she was too far out for most people.
zh: 我听说对大多数人来说，她有点太另类了。

en: Almost everyone believed the rumor.
zh: 几乎所有人都信了那个谣言。

en: Almost no one thinks that we are sisters.
zh: 几乎没人觉得我们是亲姐妹。

en: In most cases, modernization is identified with Westernization.
zh: 在大多数情况下，现代化被等同于西方化。

en: Most girls think that they are pretty.
zh: 大多数女孩子都觉得自个儿挺漂亮的。

en: I think that most young people like rock music.
zh: 我觉得大多数年轻人都喜欢摇滚乐。

en: Most accidents happen around the corner.
zh: 大多数事故都发生在转角处。

en: Most dogs are inclined to be friendly.
zh: 大多数狗通常都很友好。

en: Almost every tourist carries a camera with him.
zh: 几乎每个游客都带着相机。

en: Most scientists think little of his finding.
zh: 大多数科学家都不看好他的发现。

en: Most houses were destroyed to pieces.
zh: 大多数房子都被毁得支离破碎。

en: Most elevators operate automatically.
zh: 大多数电梯都是自动运行的。

en: Most of the dogs are alive.
zh: 那些狗里，大多数都还活着。

en: Most Americans are descended from immigrants.
zh: 大多数美国人都是移民的后裔。

en: It will make most Americans uncomfortable if you insist on their accepting expensive gifts.
zh: 要是你非要让美国人收贵重礼物，大多数人会觉得不自在的。

en: The most instinctive act of nearly every creature is to protect its young, and with humans, this response persists for a lifetime.
zh: 保护幼崽几乎是所有生物的天性，对人类来说，这种本能会伴随一生。

en: Almost no one believed him.
zh: 几乎没人相信他。

en: Nearly all Japanese have dark hair.
zh: 几乎所有日本人的头发都是黑色的。

en: Almost all parents see to the education of their children.
zh: 几乎所有父母都会关注孩子的教育。

en: Almost all boys can play baseball.
zh: 几乎所有男生都会打棒球。

en: Almost all the students know about it.
zh: 几乎所有的学生都知道这件事。

en: Almost all the students enjoy their school life.
zh: 几乎所有的学生都很享受学校生活。

en: Almost all of the dogs are alive.
zh: 几乎所有的狗都还活着。

en: Bottle or glass?
zh: 瓶装的还是杯装的？

en: It's a pain in the neck.
zh: 这事儿真让人头疼。

en: Drunk in moderation, alcohol is not harmful.
zh: 适量饮酒对身体没什么害处。

en: Soon the sound died away.
zh: 很快声音就消失了。

en: Would you send, by real mail, some brochures that will help me to choose a hotel?
zh: 你能给我邮寄一些帮我选酒店的小册子吗？

en: Will you give me a ride to my hotel?
zh: 你能载我去酒店吗？

en: Could you take me as far as my hotel?
zh: 你能送我到酒店吗？

en: Take a taxi to the hotel.
zh: 打个车去酒店吧。

en: The hotel was burned to the ground.
zh: 那家酒店被烧得精光。

en: The hotel charged me 8000 yen for the room.
zh: 那家酒店收了我八千日元的房费。

en: The hotel fronts the lake.
zh: 那家酒店面朝湖泊。

en: Is the hotel close to the airport?
zh: 酒店离机场近吗？

en: Fully booked for the night, the hotel had to turn away some late guests.
zh: 酒店当晚客满了，不得不把迟到的客人都拒之门外。

en: I'd like a hotel reservation.
zh: 我想预订酒店。

en: What was the name of the hotel? I can't recall it.
zh: 那家酒店叫什么名字来着？我想不起来了。

en: Please get me hotel security.
zh: 请帮我叫下酒店保安。

en: Did you reserve a room at the hotel?
zh: 你在酒店订好房间了吗？

en: Are the hotel rooms supplied with hair dryers?
zh: 酒店房间里提供吹风机吗？

en: The hotel telephone is in the hall and Harriet is trying to ring the police now.
zh: 酒店电话在大厅里，哈丽雅特正试着打电话报警。

en: Is there a hairdresser in the hotel?
zh: 酒店里有理发店吗？

en: Is there a barber shop in the hotel?
zh: 酒店里有理发店吗？

en: Is there a photo shop in the hotel?
zh: 酒店里有照相馆吗？

en: Is there a flower shop in the hotel?
zh: 酒店里有花店吗？

en: Is there a souvenir shop in the hotel?
zh: 酒店里有纪念品店吗？

en: Please pick me up by car in front of the hotel.
zh: 请开车到酒店门口接我。

en: There is a bank in front of the hotel.
zh: 酒店门前有一家银行。

en: I'd like to talk to the hotel manager.
zh: 我想找酒店经理谈谈。

en: During lunch in the hotel dining room, the girl named Stella collapsed, and when Dr. Stewart examined the body he said...
zh: 在酒店餐厅吃午饭时，那个叫斯特拉的女孩晕倒了，斯图尔特医生检查后说……

en: I have some things in the hotel safe.
zh: 我有些东西放在酒店的保险柜里。

en: Where's the information center for hotels?
zh: 酒店咨询中心在哪儿？

en: Let's inquire about our hotel reservations.
zh: 咱们去咨询一下酒店预订的事吧。

en: You can use the hotel's swimming pool.
zh: 你可以用酒店的游泳池。

en: I had a part-time job as a hotel maid, but I didn't like it very much.
zh: 我以前在酒店当过保洁员，但我不太喜欢那份工作。

en: It was dark when I reached the hotel.
zh: 我到酒店的时候天已经黑了。

en: Make sure you have reserved a room at the hotel.
zh: 确认一下你已经在酒店定好房间了。

en: Is there a book store in the hotel?
zh: 酒店里有书店吗？

en: The road which leads to the hotel is narrow.
zh: 通往酒店的那条路很窄。

en: I'm planning to stay at the hotel.
zh: 我打算住那家酒店。

en: There are five other guests at the hotel.
zh: 酒店里还有另外五位客人。

en: Do you have a doctor or nurse in this hotel?
zh: 酒店里有医生或者护士吗？

en: I had hardly checked in at the hotel when he called me.
zh: 我刚在酒店办完入住，他就给我打电话了。

en: My hotel told me to call you.
zh: 我住的酒店让我给你打个电话。

en: Make certain where the emergency exit is before you go to bed at a hotel.
zh: 在酒店睡觉前一定要搞清楚紧急出口在哪儿。

en: The hotel provided us with sandwiches and coffee.
zh: 酒店给我们提供了三明治和咖啡。

en: The hotel was burned down.
zh: 酒店被烧掉了。

en: I can't feel at home in a hotel.
zh: 住酒店总让我感觉没在家里那么自在。

en: The scene from the hotel was very beautiful.
zh: 从酒店看到的景色非常美。

en: The hotel was in sight.
zh: 已经能看到酒店了。

en: We could see the full extent of the park from the hotel.
zh: 从酒店可以俯瞰整个公园。

en: One large fries and two medium cokes.
zh: 一份大薯和两杯中可。

en: Which are you better at, boogie-boarding or surfing?
zh: 趴板冲浪和普通冲浪，你更擅长哪一个？

en: Do you care for pop songs?
zh: 你喜欢流行歌曲吗？

en: I like pop music.
zh: 我喜欢流行音乐。

en: The more popcorn you eat, the more you want.
zh: 爆米花越吃越想吃。

en: Please fill the teapot with boiling water.
zh: 请往茶壶里倒满开水。

en: I feel better when I drink hot lemon juice.
zh: 喝点热柠檬汁我觉得舒服多了。

en: Pour melted butter over the popcorn.
zh: 把融化的黄油淋在爆米花上。

en: May I have some more tea if there is any in the pot?
zh: 如果壶里还有茶，能不能再给我倒点？

en: There cannot be any tea left in the pot.
zh: 壶里不可能还有茶了。

en: There must have been some more tea in the pot.
zh: 壶里刚才肯定还有茶。

en: There is little coffee left in the pot.
zh: 壶里没剩多少咖啡了。

en: There wasn't much sugar in the pot.
zh: 罐子里没多少糖了。

en: I made a thermos full of coffee so you can take it along with your lunch.
zh: 我装满了一暖瓶咖啡，你可以午饭时带着喝。

en: Is there any water in the pot?
zh: 壶里有水吗？

en: I'll have two hot dogs with mustard and ketchup.
zh: 我要两个热狗，加点芥末和番茄酱。

en: To our relief, he came back safe and sound.
zh: 让我们松了一口气的是，他平安无事地回来了。

en: The pot is boiling over.
zh: 锅里的东西煮得扑出来了。

en: Will you please lend me a stapler?
zh: 能借我一下订书机吗？

en: Mr Potter keeps himself in good condition by going jogging every day.
zh: 波特先生通过每天慢跑来保持良好的身体状态。

en: Young girls' desire for slim figures is strong.
zh: 年轻女孩非常渴望拥有苗条的身材。

en: In hockey and soccer, goals are counted as points.
zh: 冰球和足球里，进球就算得分。

en: Pochi came running toward us.
zh: 波奇冲着我们跑过来了。

en: Pochi and Moko are in the kennel, and other dogs are playing in the garden.
zh: 波奇和莫可都在狗窝里，别的狗在院子里玩。

en: You have only to push the button to open the bay window.
zh: 只要按一下这个按钮，飘窗就开了。

en: Did you push the button?
zh: 你按按钮了吗？

en: I found the button loose.
zh: 我发现扣子松了。

en: The button came off.
zh: 扣子掉了。

en: Don't touch that button!
zh: 别碰那个按钮！

en: A button has come off the coat.
zh: 大衣上掉了一个扣子。

en: There are buttons on the coat.
zh: 这件大衣上有扣子。

en: A button came off my coat.
zh: 我大衣上的扣子掉了一个。

en: One of your buttons has come off.
zh: 你有一颗扣子掉了。

en: The boss could not approve of what one of his men did.
zh: 老板不太赞成他一个手下做的事。

en: The boss made them work day and night.
zh: 老板让他们没日没夜地干活。

en: The boss has a good opinion of your work.
zh: 老板觉得你干得不错。

en: The boss called him out for his blunders.
zh: 老板因为他的低级错误把他训了一顿。

en: The boss has been on his high horse all month long.
zh: 老板这个月一直摆出一副高高在上的架子。

en: The boss called Jim into his office and gave him his pink slip.
zh: 老板把吉姆叫进办公室，把他给开除了。

en: When the boss checks our expenses it can be pretty dicey. He knows how to read between the lines.
zh: 老板查报销的时候挺麻烦的，他特别精，能看穿那些弯弯绕。

en: Put me through to the boss, please.
zh: 请帮我转接给老板。

en: I can't keep this up. It's an emotional roller coaster around here and all we have to do is look at the boss's face to know whether everybody is going to be happy or sad.
zh: 我快受不了了，这儿的情绪起伏就像坐过山车，只要看老板脸色就知道大家接下来是高兴还是难受。

en: I've come under pressure from my boss.
zh: 老板给了我不少压力。

en: The boss said this group is a real mixed bag. I wonder if he places me with the wheat or the chaff.
zh: 老板说这组人良莠不齐，我不知道他觉得我是好的还是差的。

en: How many flights to Boston do you offer a day?
zh: 每天有多少班飞往波士顿的航班？

en: Competition for the position is very intense.
zh: 这个职位的竞争非常激烈。

en: What track for Boston?
zh: 去波士顿是在哪个站台？

en: What time does the train for Boston leave?
zh: 去波士顿的火车几点开？

en: I want to get a connecting flight to Boston.
zh: 我想买去波士顿的联程机票。

en: It's a long way to Boston.
zh: 去波士顿的路挺远的。

en: Boston is too cold for me, let alone Chicago.
zh: 波士顿对我来说都太冷了，更别说芝加哥了。

en: I was a stranger in Boston.
zh: 我在波士顿人生地不熟的。

en: Which part of Boston are you going to?
zh: 你去波士顿的哪个区？

en: Is this the right bus for Boston?
zh: 这辆大巴是去波士顿的吗？

en: We were ten miles short of Boston.
zh: 我们离波士顿还有十英里。

en: I looked about for the mailbox.
zh: 我四处找了找邮筒。

en: Where is the mailbox?
zh: 邮筒在哪儿？

en: My host family often advises me.
zh: 我的寄宿家庭经常给我提建议。

en: You're in luck because the boss is in.
zh: 你运气不错，老板正好在。

en: The posters were immediately removed from the wall.
zh: 墙上的海报马上就被撕掉了。

en: I succeeded in getting what I wanted.
zh: 我成功拿到了我想要的东西。

en: Take as many cookies as you want.
zh: 饼干想吃多少就拿多少。

en: The dust rose in clouds.
zh: 灰尘漫天飞扬。

en: Dust covers the desk.
zh: 书桌上全是灰。

en: Look out for pickpockets.
zh: 小心扒手。

en: Don't speak with your hands in your pockets.
zh: 别把手插在口袋里说话。

en: Pocket calculators are as cheap to buy as a pair of socks, and as essential to thousands of British school children as a pencil and eraser.
zh: 便携计算器像袜子一样便宜，而且对成千上万的英国学生来说，它跟铅笔橡皮一样是必需品。

en: It is rude to speak with your hands in your pockets.
zh: 手插在口袋里说话很不礼貌。

en: Show me what you have in your pocket.
zh: 让我看看你口袋里装了什么。

en: I found no money left in my pocket.
zh: 我发现我兜里一分钱都没剩。

en: A pencil is sticking out of your pocket.
zh: 你口袋里露出来一根铅笔。

en: Don't keep me waiting here like this.
zh: 别让我在这儿这么干等着。

en: We crossed the lake in a boat.
zh: 我们坐船过了湖。

en: We have to be ready to go through dangers there.
zh: 我们得准备好在那儿面对危险。

en: I used to listen to the calls of the wild birds in this forest.
zh: 我以前经常在这片森林里听野鸟的叫声。

en: Tomorrow is my day off.
zh: 明天我休息。

en: I'm not used to staying up late at night.
zh: 我不习惯熬夜。

en: I wish to see my father.
zh: 我想见见我父亲。

en: I tried to cheer her up, but she did nothing but cry.
zh: 我试着哄她开心，可她只是一直哭。

en: I think death is preferable to shame.
zh: 我觉得宁死也不愿受辱。

en: I don't know, nor do I care.
zh: 我不知道，也不在乎。

en: I'm about ready.
zh: 我快准备好了。

en: I go to bed very early.
zh: 我睡得很早。

en: I don't like to speak in public.
zh: 我不喜欢当众讲话。

en: As a boy I used to lie on my back on the grass and look at the white clouds.
zh: 小时候，我经常仰面躺在草地上看白云。

en: I'm a little angry with you.
zh: 我有点儿生你的气。

en: I have no time to put my books in order before I go.
zh: 我走之前没时间整理书了。

en: I neither drink nor smoke.
zh: 我不抽烟也不喝酒。

en: I am an eager student of magic.
zh: 我对魔术很痴迷。

en: I'm up to the ears in debt.
zh: 我欠了一屁股债。

en: I will never go out of my way.
zh: 我绝不会自找麻烦。

en: I have half a mind to see that myself.
zh: 我挺想亲自去看看的。

en: I have a great mind to do that myself.
zh: 我很想亲自去做那件事。

en: I don't see why I am in a bad humor this morning.
zh: 我不明白今天早上我怎么心情这么差。

en: Yesterday I ran into Yamada, whom I hadn't seen in years.
zh: 昨天我碰到了好几年没见的山田。

en: I was laughed at in school today.
zh: 我今天在学校被嘲笑了。

en: I am so full of foolish ideas today.
zh: 我今天满脑子都是些乱七八糟的想法。

en: I have gone astray somewhere in my calculations.
zh: 我算的哪儿出错了。

en: I will take you for a swim.
zh: 我带你去游泳吧。

en: I don't believe you. You're always telling lies.
zh: 我才不信你，你老是撒谎。

en: I am fed up with your nonsense.
zh: 我听够了你的废话。

en: I am no younger than you are.
zh: 我不比你年轻。

en: I will go between you and your father.
zh: 我去帮你和你父亲说和一下。

en: I put on an air of interest.
zh: 我装出一副很感兴趣的样子。

en: I used to keep a diary in English when I was a student.
zh: 我当学生的时候经常写英文日记。

en: I walked the whole way to the station.
zh: 我是一路走到车站的。

en: I am going to put my heart into the work.
zh: 我会全身心地投入到工作中。

en: In my opinion he is not fit for the work.
zh: 在我看来，他不适合这份工作。

en: I met Roy, who asked me to give you this one.
zh: 我碰到了罗伊，他让我把这个给你。

en: I haven't touched a tennis racket in years.
zh: 我好几年没碰过网球拍了。

en: I'm Tom Hunter.
zh: 我是汤姆·亨特。

en: I meet him on occasion at the club.
zh: 我偶尔会在俱乐部碰见他。

en: I was at my wit's end as to how to act.
zh: 我当时都不知道该怎么办好了。

en: I will not let the story go out.
zh: 我不会让这事儿传出去的。

en: I will try it again.
zh: 我会再试一次。

en: I remember it as if it were yesterday, but in reality it was fifteen years ago.
zh: 我记得那事儿就跟发生在昨天似的，但其实已经过去十五年了。

en: I have no knowledge of that question.
zh: 我对那个问题一无所知。

en: I have to assign more men to that work.
zh: 我得给那项工作多派点人手。

en: I went through my money in a very short time.
zh: 我很快就把钱花光了。

en: I had my composition corrected by Mr Jones.
zh: 我的作文是请琼斯先生改的。

en: I'm feeling fit.
zh: 我感觉身体挺好的。

en: I say this from my heart.
zh: 我是真心说这话的。

en: I know nothing but this.
zh: 我就只知道这个。

en: I know only this.
zh: 我就知道这么多。

en: I'm not familiar with this part of the subject.
zh: 这块内容我不太熟。

en: I am not concerned with this matter.
zh: 这事跟我没关系。

en: I came across this book in a secondhand bookstore.
zh: 我是在旧书店偶然看到这本书的。

en: I want to emphasize this point in particular.
zh: 我特别想强调这一点。

en: I have to keep my mind on this important question.
zh: 我得专心考虑这个重要问题。

en: I will put this business through in a week.
zh: 我一周之内就能把这事办成。

en: I think this one is inferior to that in quality.
zh: 我觉得这个质量没那个好。

en: I'm a coward when it comes to cockroaches.
zh: 我特别怕蟑螂。

en: I don't like coffee.
zh: 我不爱喝咖啡。

en: I prefer tea to coffee.
zh: 比起咖啡，我更喜欢喝茶。

en: I am interested in getting a hat like this.
zh: 我想买顶这样的帽子。

en: I am sure that Jim made up that story.
zh: 我敢肯定那故事是吉姆编的。

en: I will not go to the trouble of taking him there.
zh: 我才不想费劲送他去那儿呢。

en: That is not my idea of him.
zh: 他在我心目中不是那样的。

en: I want some money.
zh: 我想要点钱。

en: I'm in need of money.
zh: 我缺钱用。

en: I felt the engine running.
zh: 我感觉到引擎在动。

en: I forgot to lift the receiver before dialing the number.
zh: 我拨号前忘了先拿起听筒。

en: I keep your interests at heart all the time.
zh: 我一直都在为你着想。

en: I am quite ready for payment.
zh: 我准备好付钱了。

en: I gave up smoking for a year.
zh: 我戒了一年的烟。

en: I caught sight of her at Shibuya.
zh: 我在涩谷看到她了。

en: I belong to the karate club.
zh: 我是空手道社团的。

en: I like tennis very much.
zh: 我特别喜欢打网球。

en: All my efforts proved of no avail.
zh: 我所有的努力都白费了。

en: Don't avoid my question.
zh: 别回避我的问题。

en: My car burns a lot of gas.
zh: 我的车特别费油。

en: My bicycle has a flat tire.
zh: 我自行车胎爆了。

en: What did you do with my glasses?
zh: 你把我的眼镜弄哪儿去了？

en: My watch stopped working.
zh: 我的表停了。

en: My pen isn't as good as yours.
zh: 我的笔没你的好用。

en: Will you find my contact lens for me?
zh: 能帮我找下隐形眼镜吗？

en: What have you done with my pen? It was here a minute ago.
zh: 你把我的笔弄哪儿去了？刚才还在这儿呢。

en: Are you still in doubt about what I have said?
zh: 你还不相信我说的话吗？

en: Me, I prefer coffee to tea.
zh: 我呢，比起茶更喜欢咖啡。

en: Leave my camera alone.
zh: 别碰我的相机。

en: My grandfather goes for a walk on fine days.
zh: 我爷爷天晴的时候会出去散步。

en: My watch gains two minutes a month.
zh: 我的表一个月快两分钟。

en: I have nothing to go by.
zh: 我没有任何依据。

en: Well, I have a suggestion to make.
zh: 那个，我有个建议。

en: I have no idea why it is so.
zh: 我也不知道为什么会这样。

en: He got mad at me for calling him Shorty.
zh: 因为我叫他“矮子”，他跟我急了。

en: I can't afford to pay so much.
zh: 我付不起这么多钱。

en: Can you give me some money?
zh: 能给我点钱吗？

en: How about going steady with me?
zh: 跟我交往吧？

en: You can come with me.
zh: 你可以跟我一起来。

en: How about going to see a movie with me?
zh: 跟我去看场电影怎么样？

en: We are to go on a hike tomorrow.
zh: 我们明天要去爬山。

en: We may as well wait.
zh: 我们还是等一下吧。

en: We have to go by the rules.
zh: 我们得按规矩办事。

en: We went to the park, and we played there.
zh: 我们去公园玩了。

en: It's all over between us.
zh: 我们之间彻底结束了。

en: No sooner had we entered the hall than the ceremony began.
zh: 我们一进礼堂，仪式就开始了。

en: I like such sports as boxing and hockey.
zh: 我喜欢拳击和曲棍球之类的运动。

en: I don't like such sports as boxing and hockey.
zh: 我不喜欢拳击和曲棍球之类的运动。

en: Boxing is not always a rough sport.
zh: 拳击并不总是一项粗野的运动。

en: Boxing has been defined as the art of hitting without being hit.
zh: 拳击被定义为“打人而不被打”的艺术。

en: Boxing Day, when presents are given to the postman, the milkman, etc., is the first week-day after Christmas.
zh: 节礼日是圣诞节后的第一个工作日，那天人们会给邮递员、送奶工等送礼物。

en: The fighter toughened up for the bout.
zh: 那个拳击手为了比赛进行了强化训练。

en: The boxer had to lose weight for the title match.
zh: 那个拳手为了冠军赛不得不减重。

en: Boxers need quick reflexes.
zh: 拳击手需要敏捷的反应。

en: The boxer was hit on the chin and went down for the count.
zh: 那个拳手下巴被打中，倒地被读秒了。

en: A boxer and an actor are coming toward us.
zh: 一个拳击手和一个演员正朝我们走过来。

en: What I mean is this.
zh: 我的意思是这样的。

en: I will get it for you.
zh: 我去帮你拿。

en: I had him come while I was still in bed.
zh: 我还没起床就让他过来了。

en: The reason I'm here is because I was asked to come.
zh: 我之所以在这儿，是因为有人叫我来。

en: I know a good Italian restaurant.
zh: 我知道一家很棒的意大利餐厅。

en: It's balmy today.
zh: 今天天气真舒服。

en: Everything else is fine.
zh: 其他的一切都好。

en: Some other boys came along.
zh: 还有几个男生也跟过来了。

en: No other man could do my work.
zh: 没人能干得了我的活儿。

en: The others have to try and catch the murderer.
zh: 其他人得设法抓住凶手。

en: You shouldn't count on others for help.
zh: 你不该指望别人的帮助。

en: I caught up with the others.
zh: 我追上了其他人。

en: Where are the other girls?
zh: 其他女生在哪儿？

en: The rest of us all had the smoked salmon.
zh: 我们剩下的几个人都吃了熏三文鱼。

en: I don't like other kinds of drinks.
zh: 我不喜欢其他种类的饮料。

en: Are you going to visit any other countries?
zh: 你还打算去别的国家吗？

en: I had to work hard to keep up with the other students.
zh: 我必须努力学习才能跟上其他同学。

en: Can I see what's on the other channels?
zh: 我能看看其他频道在放什么吗？

en: Is there no alternative to your method?
zh: 除了你的办法，就没有别的选择了吗？

en: Do you feel pain in any other part of your body?
zh: 你身上还有别的地方疼吗？

en: Is everything OK here?
zh: 这儿一切都还好吧？

en: We agreed that there was no other alternative.
zh: 我们都同意没有别的选择了。

en: Is anyone else bidding?
zh: 还有其他人出价吗？

en: There isn't anywhere else to park.
zh: 没别的地方可以停车了。

en: Can I bring you anything else?
zh: 还要我帮你拿点别的吗？

en: Do you have anything else to order?
zh: 您还要点别的吗？

en: Was anybody else absent?
zh: 还有谁没来吗？

en: Who else came to the party?
zh: 还有谁去参加派对了？

en: There being nothing else to do, we went for a drive.
zh: 既然没别的事可做，我们就开车出去兜风了。

en: Who else is gone today?
zh: 今天还有谁不在？

en: Throw the ball back to me.
zh: 把球扔回给我。

en: Please throw the ball.
zh: 请把球扔过来。

en: Pass the ball quickly to a person behind you.
zh: 快把球传给你身后的人。

en: They filled them with straw to make them round and hard.
zh: 他们往里面塞满了稻草，好让它们又圆又硬。

en: Chuck me the ball.
zh: 把球扔给我。

en: It is necessary that the halls be well cleaned.
zh: 走廊得好好打扫一下。

en: The ballboys and ballgirls all come from local schools.
zh: 球童都是从当地学校挑的。

en: I have a ball-point pen, but I want another.
zh: 我有一支圆珠笔，但我还想要一支。

en: My ballpoint pen just ran out of ink.
zh: 我的圆珠笔刚没水了。

en: Fill out the form in ballpoint.
zh: 用圆珠笔填这张表。

en: Write with a ballpoint pen.
zh: 用圆珠笔写。

en: Will you write with a ballpoint pen?
zh: 你要用圆珠笔写吗？

en: Paul makes it a rule not to be late for his appointments.
zh: 保罗有个准则，就是约会从不迟到。

en: Paul stood with his hand shading his eyes.
zh: 保罗站着，用手遮着眼睛。

en: The hall was filled to capacity.
zh: 大厅里坐满了人。

en: Paul went to the party in place of his father.
zh: 保罗替他父亲去参加聚会了。

en: The ball hit him on the left side of the head.
zh: 球砸到了他头的左侧。

en: The ball rolled on the ground towards me.
zh: 球在地上朝我滚了过来。

en: Paul prefers English to math.
zh: 比起数学，保罗更喜欢英语。

en: Paul offered a new plan.
zh: 保罗提出了一个新方案。

en: Paul put on gloves before going out.
zh: 保罗出门前戴上了手套。

en: The ball rolled across the lawn.
zh: 球滚过了草坪。

en: Paul is punctual like a clock.
zh: 保罗守时得像闹钟一样。

en: Paul made a lot of money last year.
zh: 保罗去年赚了很多钱。

en: The hall could seat a thousand people before it was partitioned.
zh: 在被隔开之前，这个大厅能坐一千人。

en: Paul studies very hard these days.
zh: 保罗最近学习特别用功。

en: The ball bounced high in the air.
zh: 球弹得老高了。

en: Balls are round.
zh: 球是圆的。

en: Paul blushed and turned away.
zh: 保罗脸红了，把脸扭到了一边。

en: Paul is by far the most charming boy in our school.
zh: 保罗绝对是我们学校最有魅力的男生。

en: Paul's knowledge of creative bookkeeping has been the secret of his ability to get all the staffing he needs.
zh: 保罗很擅长“灵活做账”，这就是他总能招到所需人手的秘诀。

en: Paul is not so much a singer as a composer.
zh: 保罗与其说是歌手，不如说是作曲家。

en: What were the balls made of? Thousands of years ago, the Egyptians made balls out of soft leather or cloth.
zh: 球是用什么做的？几千年前，埃及人用软皮或布料做球。

en: Paul wasn't with Mary when her purse was stolen.
zh: 玛丽钱包被偷的时候，保罗没和她在一起。

en: The ball bounded away into our neighbor's garden.
zh: 球弹到了邻居家的花园里。

en: Paul is so pleasant a person that everybody likes him at once.
zh: 保罗人特别随和，大家一见他就喜欢他。

en: That's the way the ball bounces.
zh: 这就是命，没办法。

en: Paul didn't become arrogant even though he was rich.
zh: 保罗虽然有钱了，但一点儿也不傲慢。

en: We have no salad in the bowl.
zh: 碗里没有沙拉了。

en: I wonder what happened to Paul.
zh: 我在想保罗出什么事了。

en: The number of the chairs in the hall is 80.
zh: 大厅里有80把椅子。

en: More guests have come than the hall can hold.
zh: 来的客人比大厅能容纳的还要多。

en: There's a telephone in the hall.
zh: 大厅里有个电话。

en: There was a large crowd in the hall.
zh: 大厅里人特别多。

en: There was a small audience in the hall.
zh: 大厅里的观众很少。

en: There were many people in the hall.
zh: 大厅里有很多人。

en: There wasn't a single vacant seat in the hall.
zh: 大厅里一个空位都没有。

en: The hall was filled with students, many of whom were girls.
zh: 大厅里坐满了学生，其中很多是女生。

en: There were plenty of guests in the hall.
zh: 大厅里有很多宾客。

en: There were a fair number of people in the hall.
zh: 大厅里的人不少。

en: Paul has three sons. They look very much alike.
zh: 保罗有三个儿子，他们长得特别像。

en: I found it a lot of fun to play tennis with Paul.
zh: 我觉得和保罗打网球特别有意思。

en: The ball hit her in the eye.
zh: 球砸中了她的眼睛。

en: Not only the balls; the bat was also stolen yesterday.
zh: 不光是球，球拍昨天也被偷了。

en: The ball rolled across the road.
zh: 球滚过马路了。

en: A ball hit her on the right leg.
zh: 球砸到了她的右腿。

en: A ball flew in through the window.
zh: 一个球从窗户飞进来了。

en: A ball is floating down the river.
zh: 一个球顺着河漂下去了。

en: Paul's success was a myth.
zh: 保罗的成功只是个传说。

en: The ball bounced up high.
zh: 球弹得很高。

en: I enjoyed the concert except that the hall was cold.
zh: 音乐会挺好的，就是大厅里太冷了。

en: We couldn't figure out what Paul wanted to do.
zh: 我们搞不清楚保罗到底想干嘛。

en: A hole in one is moving on the whole.
zh: 总的来说，一杆进洞挺让人激动的。

en: Just once, I'd like to get a hole-in-one some day.
zh: 我真希望哪天能打个一杆进洞，哪怕就一次。

en: Do you think we'll make it to the airport in time, Paul?
zh: 保罗，你觉得我们能按时赶到机场吗？

en: Count me out if you go bowling.
zh: 你们要是去打保龄球的话，就别叫我了。

en: Poland ceased to exist as a nation for 120 years.
zh: 波兰作为一个国家曾消失了120年。

en: Paula is going to wash the car tomorrow.
zh: 宝拉明天要去洗车。

en: Paula has to help her father in the kitchen.
zh: 宝拉得去厨房帮她爸爸。

en: Did Paula study for today's test?
zh: 宝拉为今天的考试复习了吗？

en: Paula was called away on urgent business.
zh: 宝拉因为急事被叫走了。

en: Paula left the room to call her mother.
zh: 宝拉离开房间去给她妈妈打电话了。

en: Bolas are made up of a long cord with two stone balls at the free ends.
zh: 投石索是由一根长绳子和两端的石球组成的。

en: It is very difficult to handle the bola, but the ancient Incas were very good at it.
zh: 投石索很难用，但古代印加人很擅长。

en: Paula and I cooked dinner on Sunday.
zh: 星期天我和宝拉一起做了晚饭。

en: Those homeless people are living hand-to-mouth.
zh: 那些无家可归的人过着吃了上顿没下顿的日子。

en: You look like you're having a lot of trouble setting up that web page. Want some help?
zh: 看你弄那个网页挺费劲的，要帮忙吗？

en: It's fine to set up a web page, just be sure you don't infringe anybody's copyright.
zh: 建网页没问题，只要确保不侵犯别人的版权就行。

en: The popularity of a web site depends on its content.
zh: 网站受不受欢迎取决于它的内容。

en: Holmes went out of the room without being noticed by anyone.
zh: 福尔摩斯悄悄走出了房间，谁也没发现。

en: In order to qualify for the homestay you must have an interview with the sponsors.
zh: 要想获得寄宿家庭的资格，你必须参加主办方的面试。

en: I would like to see Mr Holmes.
zh: 我想见见福尔摩斯先生。

en: Homesickness is a longing to go back to where you are from.
zh: 思乡就是一种想回到家乡的渴望。

en: I feel homesick.
zh: 我想家了。

en: I blew my whole bonus on shopping and travel.
zh: 我把奖金全花在购物和旅游上了。

en: I received my bonus.
zh: 我领到奖金了。

en: I was disappointed to see that my bonus was a bit less than I was expecting.
zh: 奖金比我预想的少了一点，挺失望的。

en: You can hire a boat by the hour.
zh: 你可以按小时租船。

en: A new team was formed in order to take part in the boat race.
zh: 为了参加划船比赛，专门组建了一支新队伍。

en: The boy rowing the boat is a friend of mine.
zh: 那个划船的男孩是我的一个朋友。

en: We went to the lake to row a boat.
zh: 我们去湖边划船了。

en: The girl rowing a boat is my cousin.
zh: 那个划船的女孩是我表妹。

en: The boat was frozen in.
zh: 船被冻在冰里了。

en: The boat danced on the choppy water.
zh: 小船在波涛汹涌的水面上颠簸。

en: The boat shipped water and nearly capsized.
zh: 船进水了，差点儿翻了。

en: The boat was tied to the shore by a cable.
zh: 船用缆绳系在岸边。

en: The boat was off balance because it was overloaded.
zh: 因为超载，船失去了平衡。

en: The boat drifted down the stream.
zh: 船顺流漂走了。

en: The boat sank to the bottom of the lake.
zh: 船沉到了湖底。

en: The boat goes down the river.
zh: 船顺河而下。

en: The boat was sucked in.
zh: 船被卷了进去。

en: The boat was cast ashore.
zh: 船被冲上了岸。

en: The boat sank in a flash.
zh: 船一下子就沉了。

en: The boat hugged the shore.
zh: 船紧贴着岸边航行。

en: Stick a notice on the board.
zh: 在告示板上贴个通知吧。

en: I'll be staying at the Portside Hotel.
zh: 我会住在港边酒店。

en: The boats are beached on shore.
zh: 船都搁浅在岸边了。

en: There are gaps between the boards in the box. If you fit them in snugly, you'll get more use out of the box.
zh: 箱子里的木板之间有缝隙，要是摆得紧凑点，能装更多东西。

en: A boat capsized.
zh: 有艘船翻了。

en: Porters often have to walk across the lines.
zh: 搬运工经常得穿过铁轨。

en: Let a porter carry your baggage.
zh: 让搬运工帮你提行李吧。

en: Portia tempered justice with mercy.
zh: 鲍西亚执法时兼顾了仁慈。

en: Mr Hawk is a kind gentleman.
zh: 霍克先生是个挺和善的绅士。

en: Dr. Hawking had almost finished writing a book.
zh: 霍金博士那本书快写完了。

en: Hawking went back to his studies.
zh: 霍金回到了他的研究中。

en: When Hawking graduated from college in 1962, he began studying for a Ph.D. in physics.
zh: 霍金1962年大学毕业后，就开始攻读物理博士学位了。

en: Again, Hawking was almost ready to give up.
zh: 霍金又一次差点就想放弃了。

en: When he started the book, Hawking was unable to write by hand at all.
zh: 开始写那本书的时候，霍金已经完全没法亲手写字了。

en: For Hawking, writing this book was not easy.
zh: 对霍金来说，写这本书可不容易。

en: It was clear that Hawking would live longer than was first thought.
zh: 很明显，霍金活得比最初预想的要长。

en: Boeing has calculated the chances of a series of crew errors leading to CFIT.
zh: 波音计算过一系列机组操作失误导致“受控飞行撞地”的几率。

en: The company's analysis shows that in over 60% of all accidents in the past ten years, the behavior of the flight crew was the dominant cause.
zh: 公司的分析显示，过去十年的事故中，超过60%的主要原因都是机组人员的操作问题。

en: Boeing's safety experts have joined others in the industry to form an international task force to try to eliminate one particular kind of air crash known as controlled flight into terrain, CFIT.
zh: 波音的安全专家和业内其他人一起成立了一个国际小组，想办法消除一种被称为“受控飞行撞地”的特定空难。

en: I talked my boyfriend into buying me a ring.
zh: 我哄着我男朋友给我买了个戒指。

en: What did you buy for your boyfriend?
zh: 你给你男朋友买了什么？

en: She got into hot water when her boyfriend called her at work.
zh: 她男朋友在上班时间给她打电话，害得她惹上了麻烦。

en: The membership of the Boy Scout troop swelled.
zh: 童子军的人数增加了不少。

en: The boy scouts went from door to door selling what they had made.
zh: 童子军挨家挨户推销他们自己做的东西。

en: Waiter, please give me a cup of tea.
zh: 服务员，麻烦给我来杯茶。

en: Waiter, give us separate checks please.
zh: 服务员，麻烦分开结账。

en: Waiter, three coffees, please.
zh: 服务员，来三杯咖啡，谢谢。

en: Barking dogs don't always bite.
zh: 爱叫的狗不一定真咬人。

en: There are people who don't like spinach.
zh: 有些人就是不爱吃菠菜。

en: Let him alone. He'll soon come around by himself.
zh: 别管他，他一会儿自己就想通了。

en: On hearing the whistle, they started at full speed.
zh: 听到哨响，他们立马全速冲了出去。

en: Rigid wheels give sufficient stability to a low-speed vehicle steered by outside forces.
zh: 对于由外力操控的低速车辆，硬质车轮能提供足够的稳定性。

en: Finding an apartment can be difficult.
zh: 找公寓挺不容易的。

en: Would you lend me your pen?
zh: 能借下你的笔吗？

en: Do you have a pen?
zh: 你有笔吗？

en: Can I borrow your pen?
zh: 我能借你的笔用用吗？

en: Would you mind lending me your pen?
zh: 介意借我支笔用用吗？

en: Pass me the pen.
zh: 把那支笔递给我。

en: I must put my ideas together before I take up a pen.
zh: 动笔写之前，我得先理理思路。

en: May I borrow your pen?
zh: 我能借用下你的笔吗？

en: Henry has no more than six dollars.
zh: 亨利身上也就六块钱。

en: Henry is old enough to support himself.
zh: 亨利已经到了可以自食其力的年纪了。

en: Henry will come of age this March.
zh: 亨利今年三月就成年了。

en: Henry was dismissed by reason of his old age.
zh: 亨利因为年纪大被辞退了。

en: Henry James was an American by birth.
zh: 亨利·詹姆斯出生就是美国人。

en: Henry wants to see you.
zh: 亨利想见见你。

en: Pens and pencils are examples of writing tools.
zh: 钢笔和铅笔都属于书写工具。

en: Ben also has something to do with the matter.
zh: 本也跟这事儿有点关系。

en: I want a pen friend.
zh: 我想交个笔友。

en: Ben put his hands in his pockets.
zh: 本把手揣在口袋里。

en: Ben is behind them, but he'll soon catch up with them.
zh: 本在他们后面，但他很快就能追上他们。

en: Ben was believed to be a criminal.
zh: 大家都觉得本是个犯人。

en: Ben committed his diary to the lawyer's care.
zh: 本把他的日记交给律师保管。

en: Ben decided to tell the lawyer everything he knew.
zh: 本决定把他知道的一切都告诉律师。

en: Ben is not as young as he looks.
zh: 本不像他看着那么年轻。

en: Ben was at a loss for what to say next.
zh: 本不知道接下来该说什么了。

en: The pen is mightier than the sword.
zh: 笔墨胜于武力。

en: Ben acted out the scene of the waitress spilling soup in his lap.
zh: 本表演了那个服务员把汤洒在他腿上的情景。

en: Ben spread a rumor about me out of malice.
zh: 本没安好心地传我的谣。

en: Ben learned to make a fire without matches.
zh: 本学会了不用火柴生火。

en: Ben, if anything, was a sensible man.
zh: 本以前其实是个挺明事理的人。

en: Ben, if anything, is a sensible man.
zh: 本其实是个挺明事理的人。

en: Ben ran a 100-meter race with Carl.
zh: 本和卡尔比了一场百米赛跑。

en: Ben and I don't get along. We have nothing in common.
zh: 我和本合不来，我们没什么共同点。

en: Who is heavier, Ben or Mike?
zh: 本和麦克谁更重？

en: Write with pen and ink.
zh: 用笔和墨水写。

en: Please write your name in pen.
zh: 请用笔写下你的名字。

en: Please write with a pen.
zh: 请用笔写。

en: You must fill the blanks in with a pen.
zh: 你必须用笔填写空格。

en: Sit down on the bench.
zh: 在长椅上坐下吧。

en: The two men sitting on the bench were Americans.
zh: 坐在长椅上的那两个男人是美国人。

en: The woman on the bench is Mrs. Brown.
zh: 长椅上的那个女人是布朗太太。

en: He seated himself on the bench.
zh: 他在长椅上坐了下来。

en: I had hardly sat down on the bench when I found it had just been painted.
zh: 我刚在长椅上坐下，就发现它刚刷过漆。

en: Let's sit down on the bench.
zh: 咱们去长椅上坐会儿吧。

en: Benson and Holmes analyzed the psychological effect of artificial insemination on parents.
zh: 本森和霍姆斯分析了人工授精对父母的心理影响。

en: Benjamin shot a bear with a rifle.

zh: 瞧你，打扮得利利落落的。真是人靠衣装马靠鞍啊。

en: Oh, you must be good at sports.
zh: 噢，那你体育肯定挺厉害的。

en: Heavy sound is being looked for.
zh: 正在寻找那种厚重的声音。

en: I needn't have painted the fence.
zh: 我本来没必要刷那个栅栏的。

en: I didn't need to paint the fence.
zh: 我当时不需要刷那个栅栏。

en: Mr Baker is not so much a teacher as a scholar.
zh: 贝克先生与其说是老师，不如说是位学者。

en: They made huge, grotesque, yet beautiful poles of red cedar.
zh: 他们用红雪松做了一些巨大、怪异但又挺漂亮的柱子。

en: Miss Baker knew that the young man would have to leave very soon, so she decided to ask him to move his car a bit, so that she could park hers in the proper place for the night before going to bed.
zh: 贝克小姐知道那个小伙子很快就得走，所以决定让他把车挪一下，好让她睡前能把车停在合适的位置过夜。

en: Mr Baker is not so much a scholar as a writer.
zh: 贝克先生与其说是学者，不如说是位作家。

en: Can I borrow your hair drier?
zh: 我能借用下你的吹风机吗？

en: I don't think I'll make the grade if I try to play professional baseball.
zh: 我觉得我要是去打职业棒球，肯定够不着那个水平。

en: The number of the front desk is No 1.
zh: 前台的号码是1号。

en: You had better check them at the front desk.
zh: 你最好去前台查一下。

en: After asking for my key at the front desk, I took the elevator to my floor.
zh: 在前台拿到钥匙后，我坐电梯上楼了。

en: Should I clean your windshield?
zh: 需要我帮你擦下挡风玻璃吗？

en: Planning the wedding before proposing is putting the cart before the horse.
zh: 还没求婚就计划婚礼，真是本末倒置。

en: Mr Frost is eligible for the post.
zh: 弗罗斯特先生符合这个职位的要求。

en: The status of the project is as follows.
zh: 项目的进展情况如下。

en: How's your project coming along?
zh: 你的项目进展得怎么样了？

en: The bath was not hot enough and I was unable to enjoy it.
zh: 洗澡水不够热，洗得一点都不舒服。

en: May I have a program?
zh: 能给我一份节目单吗？

en: Florence Nightingale is famous as the woman who began professional nursing.
zh: 南丁格尔作为职业护理的创始人而闻名。

en: What kind of musicals are on Broadway right now?
zh: 现在百老汇都有什么音乐剧？

en: I'm dying for frozen yogurt.
zh: 我真想吃冷冻酸奶，想疯了。

en: Brokers made a killing because of the high yen.
zh: 经纪人因为日元升值赚翻了。

en: Nobody contributed to the understanding of dreams as much as Freud.
zh: 没谁比弗洛伊德对梦的研究贡献更大了。

en: Freud originated psychoanalysis.
zh: 弗洛伊德创立了精神分析学。

en: Floyd, what's the matter?
zh: 弗洛伊德，怎么了？

en: Brent is an American, but he speaks Japanese as if it were his mother tongue.
zh: 布伦特是个美国人，但他日语说得跟母语一样溜。

en: Freddy's been working the graveyard shift the past month, so he hasn't been able to see any of his friends who work normal hours.
zh: 弗雷迪这一个月都在上夜班，所以一直没机会见那些正常时间上班的朋友。

en: Have you heard from Freddie?
zh: 你最近有弗雷迪的消息吗？

en: Fred wrote his mother a long letter.
zh: 弗雷德给他妈写了一封长信。

en: Fred had his little brother paint the fence.
zh: 弗雷德让他弟弟刷了篱笆。

en: Fred is a lazy fellow.
zh: 弗雷德是个懒家伙。

en: Fred grew up to be a surgeon.
zh: 弗雷德长大后当了一名外科医生。

en: Fred went so far as to say that he had hated me.
zh: 弗雷德居然说他以前一直很讨厌我。

en: Fred followed my mother wherever she went.
zh: 我妈走到哪儿，弗雷德就跟到哪儿。

en: Fred told his wife about the goals that he wanted to accomplish.
zh: 弗雷德跟妻子说了说他想达成的目标。

en: Fred left his wife a large fortune.
zh: 弗雷德给妻子留了一大笔遗产。

en: Fred tried to get to the door, but the table was in the way.
zh: 弗雷德想去开门，但桌子挡住了路。

en: Fred often comes late for class.
zh: 弗雷德上课经常迟到。

en: Fred is always telling lies.
zh: 弗雷德老是撒谎。

en: Fred took a liking to Jane and started dating her.
zh: 弗雷德看上了简，开始跟她约会了。

en: Fred spent all day looking for a job.
zh: 弗雷德找了一整天工作。

en: Fred looked after the child who had no parents until that child graduated from college.
zh: 弗雷德一直照顾那个孤儿，直到那孩子大学毕业。

en: Fred's house has five rooms.
zh: 弗雷德家有五个房间。

en: Because he thought Fred's comment was tacky, Larry got up on his high horse.
zh: 因为觉得弗雷德的话很没品，拉里开始摆起谱来了。

en: Fred has very little patience, and it doesn't take much to make him fly off the handle.
zh: 弗雷德没什么耐心，动不动就大发雷霆。

en: The boy talking with Fred is Mike.
zh: 正在跟弗雷德说话的那个男孩是迈克。

en: Fred and George took turns with the driving.
zh: 弗雷德和乔治轮流开车。

en: Did you hear that Fred has been shown the door?
zh: 你听说了吗？弗雷德被炒鱿鱼了。

en: Fred kicked a ball.
zh: 弗雷德踢了一脚球。

en: It makes no difference to me whether Fred came to the party or not.
zh: 弗雷德来没来派对，对我来说都一样。

en: Can you gift-wrap this, please?
zh: 麻烦帮我把这个礼品包装一下好吗？

en: Fred, behave, and I'm not joking, either.
zh: 弗雷德，规矩点，我可没跟你开玩笑。

en: Could you gift wrap it?
zh: 能帮我包装成礼物吗？

en: Thank you for your present.
zh: 谢谢你的礼物。

en: Will the present make him happier?
zh: 这个礼物会让他更开心吗？

en: It is best to review the material before the presentation.
zh: 做展示之前最好先过一遍材料。

en: Please give us a 20-30 min. time slot for our presentation.
zh: 请给我们留20到30分钟做展示。

en: Since PlayStation 2 came out the game software store shelves have bloomed riotously with colorful new titles.
zh: 自从PlayStation 2上市以来，游戏店的货架上就摆满了琳琅满目的新游戏。

en: I'm really looking forward to next March, when they roll out the new Play Station 2.
zh: 我特别期待明年三月，到时候新的PlayStation 2就要上市了。

en: Blake loved to walk in the country round London.
zh: 布莱克很喜欢在伦敦郊外散步。

en: Press the brake pedal to turn on your brake lights.
zh: 踩下刹车踏板，刹车灯就亮了。

en: The function of the brake is to stop the car.
zh: 刹车的作用就是让车停下来。

en: Something is wrong with the brakes.
zh: 刹车出问题了。

en: The brakes did not work.
zh: 刹车失灵了。

en: You must be crazy to ride a bicycle that has no brakes!
zh: 你疯了吧，骑个没刹车的自行车！

en: The brake isn't working well.
zh: 刹车不太灵。

en: The brake didn't work.
zh: 刹车没管用。

en: The brake stopped working.
zh: 刹车不灵了。

en: Come and join us.
zh: 过来加入我们吧。

en: Plain English is a shortcut to the goal of language learning.
zh: 简单的英语是学好语言的捷径。

en: It seems that Mr Brooke is an honest man.
zh: 看起来布鲁克先生是个老实人。

en: You can eat a complete meal, or just go easy with our salad bar.
zh: 你可以点一份完整的套餐，或者去沙拉吧吃点简单的。

en: The girl in a blue coat is my daughter.
zh: 那个穿蓝外套的女孩是我女儿。

en: I don't want to feel blue.
zh: 我不想心情不好。

en: I plan to play a flute solo.
zh: 我打算表演长笛独奏。

en: Do you want another glass of fruit punch?
zh: 你想再来一杯果汁潘趣酒吗？

en: I think that a new fruit drink will go over big during the summer.
zh: 我觉得这款新出的果汁饮料在夏天肯定会大火。

en: Brutus stabs Caesar, and Caesar falls.
zh: 布鲁图斯刺向凯撒，凯撒倒下了。

en: Bruce was terribly upset when his girlfriend left him, but he soon got over it.
zh: 女朋友离开布鲁斯时他特别难受，但他很快就走出来了。

en: Blue Sky Sport is closed every Thursday.
zh: 蓝天体育每周四关门。

en: Do you remember what day of the week Blue Sky Sports is closed?
zh: 你记得蓝天体育周几休息吗？

en: Here's your pudding.
zh: 给，你的布丁。

en: You look very good in blue.
zh: 你穿蓝色很好看。

en: A prism decomposes light.
zh: 三棱镜可以分解光。

en: Please replace the empty ink jet cartridge in the printer.
zh: 请更换打印机里用完的墨盒。

en: Is there anywhere I can go to find a flea market?
zh: 这附近哪儿有跳蚤市场吗？

en: Call us toll-free at 1-800-446-2581.
Age brandy in oak casks.
zh: 白兰地要在橡木桶里陈酿。

en: I like my brandy straight.
zh: 我喜欢白兰地净饮。

en: The brandy brought him around in no time.
zh: 那杯白兰地让他立刻缓过劲儿来了。

en: The brandy is getting to my head.
zh: 这白兰地让我有点上头了。

en: They brought her round with brandy.
zh: 他们用白兰地让她醒了过来。

en: I want to eat French cuisine.
zh: 我想吃法餐。

en: The President of France visited Okinawa.
zh: 法国总统访问了冲绳。

en: The French are said to love art.
zh: 据说法国人都很热爱艺术。

en: The French are our neighbors across the Channel.
zh: 法国人是我们在英吉利海峡对岸的邻居。

en: I have a daughter who's married to a Frenchman.
zh: 我有个女儿嫁给了一个法国人。

en: Do you like French wines?
zh: 你喜欢法国葡萄酒吗？

en: I want a person who can speak French.
zh: 我想要个会说法语的人。

en: To speak French is difficult.
zh: 说法语挺难的。

en: It comes natural to him to speak French.
zh: 对他来说，说法语是自然而然的事。

en: No one can match her in speaking French.
zh: 没人能比她法语说得更好。
